meanings.definition: A heading at the top of an article or page in a newspaper or magazine.
meanings.sent1: The headline of the newspaper announced the big news.
meanings.sent2: She read the headline of the magazine to see what was happening.
meanings.sent3: The headline of the newspaper made everyone laugh with its funny typo.
meanings.sent4: The headline of the article was like a beacon, guiding readers to the main story.
meanings.sent5: The bold headline caught everyone's attention immediately.

meanings.definition: A line of text at the top of a poster or advertisement.
meanings.sent1: The headline on the poster was eye-catching and drew people in.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement's headline was short but effective in conveying the message.
meanings.sent3: The headline on the poster was so big that it almost covered the entire page.
meanings.sent4: The headline on the advertisement was like a spotlight, shining on the product.
meanings.sent5: The colorful headline on the poster stood out among the other text.

meanings.definition: To be the main attraction or feature of an event or situation.
meanings.sent1: The singer hoped to headline the concert and draw a large crowd.
meanings.sent2: The new movie will headline the film festival next month.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to headline the show and make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The talented artist will headline the art exhibition with her latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The popular band will headline the music festival and close the event with a bang.
